text: John Deely (April 26, 1942 – January 7, 2017) was an American philosopher and semiotician.See Paul Cobley’s remark, in Realism for the 21st Century: A John Deely Reader (ed. Cobley), p. 3: “While Charles Sanders Peirce is acknowledged as the greatest American philosopher, John Deely, in his wake, is arguably the most important living American philosopher.” Cf. in same volume the multifarious and world-spanning recommendations of Deely’s work from countries as diverse as Africa, Austria, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, China, Denmark, England, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Italy, Mexico, New Zealand, Poland, Romania, Russia, Singapore, Spain, Taiwan, Ukraine, and the US. He was a Professor of Philosophy at Saint Vincent College and Seminary in Latrobe, Pennsylvania. He was at the Center for Thomistic Studies of the University of St. Thomas in Houston, Texas. He was born in Chicago, Illinois. Deely died in Latrobe, Pennsylvania on January 7, 2017 from cancer, aged 74. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Pennsylvania Category:American philosophers Category:Educators from Pennsylvania Category:Writers from Pennsylvania Category:Writers from Chicago Category:People from Latrobe, Pennsylvania Category:Writers from Houston Category:Educators from Houston Category:Educators from Chicago
